definition: lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
(negative prefix)/not/no
to dare/daring/(polite) may I venture
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
lit. I'm ashamed and dare not (accept the honor); fig. I do not deserve your praise./You flatter me too much.

sentences.english: The centurion replied, "Lord, I do not deserve to have you come under my roof.
sentences.chinese: 百夫长回答说，主阿，你到我舍下，我不敢当。

sentences.english: He said that he really didn't deserve they should be so kind .
sentences.chinese: 他说他们对他这样好他确实不敢当。

sentences.english: I dare you to speak to my face.
You're too nervous to tell her face to face.
sentences.chinese: 你紧张得不敢当面向她表白。

sentences.english: Therefore I did not presume to come to you.
sentences.chinese: 因你到我舍下，我不敢当。

definition: to speak seriously/to exaggerate
lit. I'm ashamed and dare not (accept the honor); fig. I do not deserve your praise./You flatter me too much.
to overpraise/to flatter
how could one dare?/I don't deserve such praise
honorific: I've long looked forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
untalented/I/me (humble)
to mock/to be ridiculed/to incur ridicule through one's poor performance (humble)
modest/self-deprecating
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
variant of 折殺|折杀[zhe2 sha1]
you let me win (said politely after winning a game)
your humble servant/I
you're too kind/you flatter me
to not deserve (one's good fortune etc)
to give advice or comments
lit. not dare to pull oneself up high (humble term)/I cannot presume on your attention
